name: ConvexHullTriangulation
author: AFNI Team
description: A program to find the convex hull, or perform a Delaunay triangulation of a set of points.

inputs.description: Create isosurface where V0 <= volume < V1
inputs.name: Isorange

inputs.description: Create isosurface where MASK_COM != 0. Example: -isocmask '-a VOL+orig -expr (1-bool(a-V))' is equivalent to using -isoval V. NOTE: Allowed only with -xform mask
inputs.name: Isocmask

inputs.description: Transform to apply to volume values before searching for sign change boundary. Options: mask, shift, none
inputs.name: Transform

inputs.description: Specify a surface volume which contains a transform to apply to the surface node coordinates
inputs.name: Surface volume

inputs.description: Construct the triangulation of the points contained in 1D file XYZ. Use AFNI's [] selectors to specify the XYZ columns.
inputs.name: Input 1D

inputs.description: Meshing option OPT. Options: convex_hull, triangulate_xy
inputs.name: Q option

inputs.description: Project points onto plane whose normal is the third principal component. Then rotate projection so that plane is parallel to Z = constant.
inputs.name: Project XY

inputs.description: Use original coordinates when writing surface, not transformed ones.
inputs.name: Original Coordinates

inputs.description: Use coordinates in COORDS.1D when writing surface.
inputs.name: Coordinates

inputs.description: Prefix of output surface. Specifies the format and prefix of the surface.
inputs.name: Output prefix

inputs.description: Ignore any Rotate, Volreg, Tagalign, or WarpDrive transformations present in the Surface Volume.
inputs.name: Ignore transformations

inputs.description: Set environment variable ENVname to be ENVvalue.
inputs.name: Set environment variable
